intro: Trichoneuron, commonly known as the common trichoneuron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, triangular leaves with a distinctive hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Trichoneuron is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
